instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hello, I have a problem on this board that when connecting headphones it only sounds through one earphone,
the tests that made logical headphones other  pass the same
I also tried with another audio jack port pass the same problem
preferences system balance sound is ok
I would like to know where do I start to measure where the problem is on the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Check all traces and small coils that connect to headphones.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: I already check traces and small coils are all fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>AUD_HP_PORT_L</SIGNAL>/R on J6701; w/ and w/o cable connected.
If all good (includin L6704/05), then change <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
mode diode <SIGNAL>AUD_HP_PORT_L</SIGNAL>=0.350    measured in ohms=259 ohms. on j6701 and l6704.        w/o cable connected.
mode diode <SIGNAL>AUD_HP_PORT_R</SIGNAL>=0.49    measured in ohms=9.63 Kilohms. on j6701and L6705.    w/o cable connected.

with cable connected same values

on A board good condition same reference <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> mode diode <SIGNAL>AUD_HP_PORT_L</SIGNAL>=0.76 <SIGNAL>AUD_HP_PORT_R</SIGNAL>=0.76 in ohms 9.7k in both

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Remove L6704 and confirm if the problem is on audio codec side.

BTW, check all the points in the same manner; red probe connected to ground!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: What all check points do you mean?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Did you measure all diode mode with red probe connected to ground???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: yes, I thought you said measure all ic audio codec points in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
You've got one different reading.
If all readings done with red probe connected to ground, then you have a problem with that line.
"Remove L6704 and confirm if the problem is on audio codec side."

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: ok thanks solved, He also has speaker problems I bought on ebay but they only worked a month, Any good quality seller where do you buy?
